w:r.w:t: The Local Venue Challenge:

As a proud owner or manager of a bar, restaurant, or cafÃ©, you pour your heart into your business. You curate the menu, set the vibe, plan special events or live entertainment, all to create great experiences. But on a given night, how do you fill the room? Small local venues face an uphill battle in the digital age: your potential customers are out there, glued to their phones,
deciding where to go right now

, but how do you reach them in that crucial decision moment? You might post on social media or stick a chalkboard with tonightâ€™s special outside your door. Maybe youâ€™re listed on Yelp/Google, but so is every place in town, and your posts get lost in feeds. Traditional marketing is expensive and often doesnâ€™t work fast enough â€“ itâ€™s hard to get the word out
tonight

about the awesome live band setting up at 9 PM, or the happy hour youâ€™re extending due to the big game on TV. The result? Empty tables on nights that could have been thriving, and missed opportunities to win new regulars.
What is Pulse for Venues?
Pulse is a real-time discovery platform for nightlife, and itâ€™s not just for users â€“ itâ€™s built with local venues like
yours
in mind. Think of Pulse as a lively marketplace of nighttime experiences. On one side, users are actively looking for where to go
right now
. On the other side, venues can broadcast whatâ€™s happening
at this very moment
. Pulse for Venues is your tool to
expose your business to nearby potential customers in real time

. Itâ€™s a direct line to the people who are making split-second decisions on where to spend their evening (and their money!). If users are the heartbeat of Pulse, venues are the lifeblood â€“ our goal is to help authentic small businesses shine, connect with customers, and thrive, all through real-time engagement.
Problem â€“ â€œIf Only They Knewâ€¦â€:
Consider how many times youâ€™ve thought,
â€œIf people only knew how great it is here tonight, theyâ€™d come in!â€

Perhaps itâ€™s a slow Wednesday and you wish you could magically tell everyone within a mile that you have a two-for-one special at the bar. too slow or too broad
. Posting on Facebook or Instagram might reach some followers, but not necessarily the folks nearby looking for a place
right now

. Flyers and ads cost money and often donâ€™t hit at the right time. Big chains with big budgets hog the spotlight online. Your authentic local venue might be exactly what a certain group of people are craving tonight, but
thereâ€™s a disconnect
â€“ they donâ€™t know about you, or what youâ€™re offering this instant, and you have no easy way to tell them. In short, youâ€™re fighting:
Limited Exposure in the Moment:

Being listed on review sites is passive; you have to hope someone stumbles on your page. And once a review is written, it might not change for months â€“ it canâ€™t say â€œJam Night tonight!â€ when thatâ€™s only true today.
You try posting events on calendars or sending emails, but those often get seen too late or by too few.
Engaging Customers & Building Loyalty:

Getting someone in the door once is one battle; getting them to come back is another. You likely have regulars, but to grow, you need new faces to become repeat customers. How to keep them informed and excited without spamming them? How to know what keeps them coming back? Traditional loyalty programs or sporadic surveys arenâ€™t giving you real insight.
No Real-Time Feedback or Analytics:

If Tuesday was unexpectedly slow, do you know why? If a Thursday event sold out, do you know where the attendees heard about it? Small businesses often lack access to timely data. Youâ€™re making gut decisions on promotions and events. Wouldnâ€™t it help to know, for example, that
50 Pulse users looked at your venue profile today from 5-6pm
but only 5 showed up â€“ indicating high interest, maybe a bit more incentive couldâ€™ve converted more? These kinds of insights are gold, but hard to obtain without a dedicated tool.
Pulse Solution â€“ Connect to Customers in Real Time, Build Your Crowd:
Pulse for Venues is designed to tackle those challenges head-on, in a way thatâ€™s simple and effective for you. Hereâ€™s how Pulse empowers your business:

Pulse gives you a live channel to people who are
actively searching
for places to go in your area. When a user opens the Pulse app in your vicinity, your venue isnâ€™t just a static name on a list â€“ it can appear with dynamic info that
you control
. You can

instantly: Is your patio now open because the sun came out? Post an update on Pulse and everyone nearby sees â€œâ˜€ï¸ Patio now open!â€. Did a large group just arrive, making your bar buzz? Mark your crowd level as â€œLivelyâ€ so Pulse users see youâ€™re hopping. Think of it as a digital neon sign that reaches an entire neighborhoodâ€™s worth of smartphones. for your venue, in bright highlights. According to the National Restaurant Association,

Your venue gets a dedicated profile on Pulse which you can manage via a simple web or mobile interface. Think of it as a living brochure. you update anytime: â€œWhatâ€™s Happening Nowâ€ â€“ where you post in-the-moment updates (e.g., â€œDJ just started!â€, â€œGame is on, crowd is pumped!â€), and â€œTodayâ€™s Specials/Eventsâ€ â€“ where you keep an up-to-date list of deals or happenings for the day. restroworks.com
. Pulse helps you nurture that retention by keeping the conversation going even after a customer leaves your door.

Over time, Pulseâ€™s insight might reveal trends (perhaps your live music nights see a spike of Pulse viewers â€“ confirming thatâ€™s a strength to double down on; or maybe Friday late-night food deals pull in a new crowd). Freemium Model with Powerful Premium Upsells:

free to join

special â€œFeatured Eventsâ€ section for all users in the city, not just those near you. Great for drawing new faces from beyond your immediate vicinity.

Weâ€™ll help our premium venue partners with best practices â€“ maybe a quarterly consultation or materials on how to maximize engagement on Pulse. The freemium approach ensures
accessibility

(you get value from day one without payment) and provides a growth path â€“ as you benefit from the free features and want more, the premium options are right there to supercharge your marketing. Itâ€™s totally up to you and scales with your needs.
Example Use Case â€“ How Pulse Fills Your Venue:

Letâ€™s paint a quick success scenario. You run â€œThe Fox & Fiddleâ€, a small pub that on most nights has a decent crowd, but Wednesdays are quiet and youâ€™d love to improve that. , hereâ€™s what happens:

. By 7:15, youâ€™ve got 15 extra customers who specifically came because they saw your Pulse update. In the app, a couple of them favorite your pub. One posts a â€œvibe videoâ€ of the guitarist playing to a happy crowd â€“ now

of other Pulse users citywide see that The Fox & Fiddle is buzzing. Some folks who usually wouldnâ€™t go out on a Wednesday decide to drop by. End result: your Wednesday went from quiet to a hit. . Several Pulse users nearby who had left a restaurant see that update and decide to swing by for dessert and coffee rather than heading straight home. You turned an otherwise slow hour into extra revenue, just by sending a timely offer to the right audience.
